Text.Value: But if I'm not, the city's guardian will be its ruin - unless we put a stop to it.
We can't and we won't, the shadows be damned.
They will infect him. And the city's guardian will become its ruin - unless we put a stop to it.
Change the subject.
The counsellor's loyalty to my father is beyond question. She's as steady as Tyr's heartbeat, as upstanding as the Sword Mountains.
As for infection... I fear you might be right.
Who better than Grand Duke Ravengard to surrender it?
I was eleven when the counsellor spotted and slayed an assassin who stalked father from the shadows.
I truly hope you're wrong about this.
Then we know our mission. All roads converge at Moonrise.
Father's at Moonrise Towers. And we need to save him.
Leave.
What's on your mind?
The Absolute's cult is headquartered there. What do you think they want with your father?
With a parasite in his head, the city's guardian would be its ruin - unless we put a stop to it.
Why bother with Ravengard? The cult's either murdered him or infected him by now.
They want violence. They want control. They want Baldur's Gate.
Me too, Shadowheart. Me too.
We can't and we won't, Ketheric Thorm be damned.
Who better than the commander of the Flaming Fist to dismantle its defences?
But if I'm right, they will infect him. And the city's guardian will become its ruin - unless we put a stop to it.
To Moonrise, then. We can't let the Absolute take Grand Duke Ravengard.
Can we trust Florrick?
I was thirteen when she brought word of a goblin warband advancing on Rivington. Her keen scouting saved a hundred lives that day.
If they wanted him dead, they would've fed him to the flames at Waukeen's Rest.
The cult must have some reason for taking your father - but what?

EditorData.logicalname: Asked if you could trust Florrick
